text: The United National Liberation Front of Western South East Asia (UNLFW) is a united front of armed separatist groups in India formed by the United Liberation Front of Assam, the National Socialist Council of Nagaland, the Kamtapur Liberation Organisation, and the National Democratic Front of Boroland. It has claimed responsibility for the ambush of eighteen Indian soldiers in Manipur in one of the deadliest attacks against Indian security forces in over thirty years. ==See also== *Insurgency in Northeast India *Internal conflict in Burma *Insurgency in Jammu and Kashmir ==References== Category:2015 establishments in India Category:Insurgency in Northeast India Category:Left-wing militant groups in India Category:National liberation armies Category:Northeast India Category:Organizations established in 2015 Category:Rebel groups in India Category:Separatism in India
title: United National Liberation Front of Western South East Asia
